Title: SACOG ABMVIZ
SideBarTextLeft: ActivityViz was initially funded by the Atlanta Regional Commission with additional support from Oregon Metro and others.
SideBarTextRight: ActivityViz is an interactive travel and activity data visualization tool. It is built with JavaScript technologies and works with various types of travel and activity data - household travel surveys, trip-based model outputs, activity-based model outputs, disaggregate passive data, freight models, on-board surveys, etc. The dashboard features several interactive and customizable visualizations for exploring data, such as 3D maps of trips in time and space, time use by person type and activity, radar charts for performance measure analysis, sunburst diagrams for visualizing mode shares, animated bubble maps, chord diagrams for OD data, point-of-interest maps for transit stop data, truck flow data, etc. ActivityViz is published using GitHub pages which eliminates most of the administrative backend in traditional systems.

content: Frequency of trips by mode by county.
Sacramento county has the largest share of trips.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove modes.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the map: Use the zone drop-down selection to view different trip modes as county colors.
For the map: Turn on bubbles under layers and use the bubbles drop-down selection to view different trip modes by county.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Trip mode
93% of people typically use cars to travel.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Each square in the graph represents 1% of the population.

3DMap.name: Daytime Population
3DMap.info: People that are not in their home zone by time-of-day
People that are not in their home zone by time-of-day

content: Frequency of persons not at home by Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ).
As the day progresses, people leave home, go to work, school, and other locations, and then return home in the evening.
Use the cycle through day button to animate the map.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

GroupedCharts.name: Day Pattern
GroupedCharts.info: Person day pattern by person type

content: Day patterns by person type (e.g., employment status, student status, age)
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove person types.

TimeUse.name: Time Use
TimeUse.info: Displays person out-of-home travel purpose by time of day. The vertical axis displays the sum or percent of activity and the horizontal axis displays the period of the day.

content: Activity by time of day
Derived from trip purpose and time at destination
Persons tend to be at home or work in the morning versus home, work, or other in the afternoon.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail by person type.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove trip purposes.

RadarCharts.name: Performance Measures
RadarCharts.info: Performance measures by county.  The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.

content: Counties by four performance measures.
The min/max by measure is scaled to the zone with the highest and lowest value.
For example, El Dorado does well across all measures.
Each radar chart shows the county score for each measure.
Counties can be compared across charts by comparing chart area.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Origins and destinations of daily trips by district.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
The connections between districts depict bi-directional flows.
Turn on desire lines in the map layers to see district-to-district trip flow lines
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
